main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object (UFO) was reported on November 25, 1957 at Scott Air Force Base, Illinois. The object was described as round, reddish-orange, and the size of a golf ball or tennis ball.
interesting points: The object was observed to exhibit a great variation in movement as reported by various witnesses.
It was initially seen ascending, then hovering and circling overhead before making a large 'U' turn back to its original direction.
Observers, A/2C Ronald W. Rious and A/2C Gareth L. Coley, were students attending Communications School at Scott Air Force Base, adding credibility to the sighting.
The weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting, and there were no local military aircraft flying in the area.
The report mentions that there was no physical evidence and no sightings by radar units or control tower attendants.
sighted object: round, reddish-orange object the size of a golf ball or tennis ball
witnesses: A/2C Ronald W. Rious and A/2C Gareth L. Coley, students at Communications School
